t: Proverbs 12
Whoever*pn loves discipline loves knowledge, but*ld whoever hates correction is stupid.
Good*pn people obtain favor from the Lord,*s but*ld he condemns those who devise wicked schemes.
No*pn one can be established through wickedness, but*ld the righteous cannot be uprooted.
A*pn wife of noble character is her husband’s crown, but*ld a disgraceful wife is like decay in his bones.
The*pn plans of the righteous are just, but*ld the advice of the wicked is deceitful.
The*pn words of the wicked lie in wait for blood, but*ld the speech of the upright rescues them.
The*pn wicked are overthrown and are no more, but*ld the house of the righteous stands firm.
A*pn person is praised according to their prudence, and*ld one with a warped mind is despised.
Better*pn to be a nobody and yet have a servant than*ld pretend to be somebody and have no food.
The*pn righteous care for the needs of their animals, but*ld the kindest acts of the wicked are cruel.
Those*pn who work their land will have abundant food, but*ld those who chase fantasies have no sense.
The*pn wicked desire the stronghold of evildoers, but*ld the root of the righteous endures.
Evildoers*pn are trapped by their sinful talk, and*ld so the innocent escape trouble.
From*pn the fruit of their lips people are filled with good things, and*ld the work of their hands brings them reward.
The*pn way of fools seems right to them, but*ld the wise listen to advice.
Fools*pn show their annoyance at once, but*ld the prudent overlook an insult.
An*pn honest witness tells the truth, but*ld a false witness tells lies.
The*pn words of the reckless pierce like swords, but*ld the tongue of the wise brings healing.
Truthful*pn lips endure forever, but*ld a lying tongue lasts only a moment.
Deceit*pn is in the hearts of those who plot evil, but*ld those who promote peace have joy.
No*pn harm overtakes the righteous, but*ld the wicked have their fill of trouble.
The*pn Lord*s detests lying lips, but*ld he delights in people who are trustworthy.
The*pn prudent keep their knowledge to themselves, but*ld a fool’s heart blurts out folly.
Diligent*pn hands will rule, but*ld laziness ends in forced labor.
Anxiety*pn weighs down the heart, but*ld a kind word cheers it up.
The*pn righteous choose their friends carefully, but*ld the way of the wicked leads them astray.
The*pn lazy do not roast any game, but*ld the diligent feed on the riches of the hunt.
In*pn the way of righteousness there is life; along*ld that path is immortality.
